title: Ocean Trout/salmon With Lime And Lemon Grass Hollandaise
summary: Ocean Trout/salmon With Lime And Lemon Grass Hollandaise might be just the main course you are searching for. One serving contains 5210 calories, 292g of protein, and 440g of fat. For $41.72 per serving, this recipe covers 78% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 1. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 30 minutes. If you have kaffir lime leaves, salmon, butter, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the unsalted butter you could follow this main course with the Almond Milk Chocolate Pudding as a dessert. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, primal, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian diet. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 75%, which is solid. Try Ocean Trout with Coleslaw and Crispy Smoked Bacon, Prawn and Salmon Stir Fry With Lemon Grass and Mint, and Salmon With Tangerine-lemon Hollandaise Sauce for similar recipes.
instructions: Combine lemon grass, shredded lime leaves, rind and juice in a saucepan, bring to the boil, reduce heat simmer, uncovered, until liquid is reduced to 1 Tablespoon.Strain through a fine sieve into a medium heatproof bowl, cool 10 Min's, discard solids.Set bowl over saucepan of simmering water, do not allow water to touch the base of the bowl, add egg yolk to juice mixture, whisk over heat until thickened.Remove bowl from heat, gradually add melted butter in a thin, steady stream, whisking constantly until sauce has thickened. (If sauce is too thick a tablespoon of hot water can be added.) stir in finely chopped kaffir lime leaves.Meanwhile, cook the fish on a heated oiled grill or fry pan until cooked as desired, serve with hollandaise. I prefer to cook my fish skin side down first and really get a nice crisp skin on it.

steps.step: Combine lemon grass, shredded lime leaves, rind and juice in a saucepan, bring to the boil, reduce heat simmer, uncovered, until liquid is reduced to 1 Tablespoon.Strain through a fine sieve into a medium heatproof bowl, cool 10 Min's, discard solids.Set bowl over saucepan of simmering water, do not allow water to touch the base of the bowl, add egg yolk to juice mixture, whisk over heat until thickened.

Remove bowl from heat, gradually add melted butter in a thin, steady stream, whisking constantly until sauce has thickened. (If sauce is too thick a tablespoon of hot water can be added.) stir in finely chopped kaffir lime leaves.Meanwhile, cook the fish on a heated oiled grill or fry pan until cooked as desired, serve with hollandaise. I prefer to cook my fish skin side down first and really get a nice crisp skin on it.
